intro: Knautia atrorubens, commonly known as the purple knautia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
